choices.C: Working from home or branch offices, all users get the benefit of a digital experience management solution without the complexity of installing additional software and hardware.
choices.A: The root cause of any alert can be viewed with a single click, allowing users to swiftly stop attacks across the environment.
choices.B: The virtual appliance receives and stores firewall logs without using a local Log Collector, simplifying required steps users must take.
choices.D: It applies in-depth hunting and forensics knowledge to identify and contain threats before they become a breach.

questions.question_text: What are two ways service connections and remote network connections differ? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Remote network connections provide secondary WAN options, but service connections use backup service connection for redundancy.
choices.B: Remote network connections enforce security policies, but service connections do not.
choices.C: An on-premises resource cannot originate a connection to the internet over a service connection.
choices.D: Service connections support both OSPF and BGP for routing protocols, but remote networks support only BGP.
Assign a Vulnerability profile to Security policy rules that deny general web access.
choices.A: Apply a File Blocking profile to Security policy rules that allow general web access.
choices.C: Assign an Antivirus profile to Security policy rules that deny general web access.
choices.B: Apply a Zone Protection profile to the untrust zone.

questions.question_text: What can prevent users from unknowingly downloading potentially malicious file types from the internet?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/network-security/security-policy/administration/security-profiles/security-profile-file-blocking
For policy rules that allow general web browsing, be stricter with your file blocking because the risk of users unknowingly downloading malicious files is much higher.

Selected Answer: A
A, Security profiles are ONLY processed if rule action is allow!

questions.question_text: How can a network engineer export all flow logs and security actions to a security information and event management (SIEM) system?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Should be A, SNMP is also supported.

Selected Answer: A
Regarding link from docu below, it should be Syslog. However, SNMP is supported too.
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-sd-wan/prisma-sd-wan-admin/prisma-sd-wan-sites-and-devices/use-external-services-for-monitoring/syslog-server-support-in-prisma-sd-wan

choices.D: Use the centralized flow data-export tool built into the controller.
choices.B: Use a zone-based firewall to export directly through application program interface (API) to the SIEM.
choices.A: Enable syslog on the Instant-On Network (ION) device.
choices.C: Enable Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) on the Instant-On Network (ION) device.
